channel.title: Bloomberg Politics
channel.copyright: Copyright 2025 BLOOMBERG L.P. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED

item.title: UK Says Turkey’s Eurofighter Bid Gains Full Consortium Backing
item.description: Turkey’s bid to buy Eurofighter Typhoon jets has won support from all consortium members, the UK said, raising prospects for a deal previously blocked by Germany.
item.dc:creator: Selcan Hacaoglu, Michael Nienaber

media:content.media:description: A Eurofighter Typhoon military jet at the Paris Air Show.

item.title: Turkish Markets Rally After Key Opposition Case Adjourned
item.description: Turkish assets rallied after a court adjourned a case that may force the removal of the main opposition party’s leader, providing short-term relief for markets concerned about rising political uncertainty.
item.dc:creator: Firat Kozok, Beril Akman, Tugce Ozsoy

media:content.media:description: Ozgur Ozel speaks on stage as attendees hold placards reading "Free Imamoglu" refering to the detention of the Mayor of Istanbul, Ekrem Imamoglu, on the second day of the German Social Democratic Party (SPD) Party Congress in Berlin, on June 28.

item.title: China Lifts Ban on Japanese Seafood Imports as Frictions Ease
item.description: China has lifted a 2023 ban on imports of seafood from most parts of Japan, removing an irritant in relations with its neighbor by starting to implement a deal reached last September.
item.dc:creator: Olivia Tam, James Mayger

media:content.media:description: A plate of tuna sushi at Yoshitsune sushi restaurant in Urayasu, Japan, on Monday, Dec. 5, 2022. Soaring tuna prices are among the items driving Japan’s fastest inflation in four decades and a fall in purchasing power that are together testing the limits of the country’s outlier policy mix. At Yoshitsune, the days of buying raw tuna are gone as the restaurant buys it frozen to stay on budget.

item.title: Viktor Orban’s Hold on Hungary May Be Slipping
item.description: Budapest just hosted one of the biggest displays of defiance of the Hungarian premier’s 15 years in office.
item.dc:creator: Piotr Skolimowski, Andras Gergely

media:content.media:description: People take part in the Pride parade in Budapest, on June 28. Photographer: ATTILA KISBENEDEK/AFP

item.title: Trump Says TikTok Buyer Group Found, Needs China Nod
item.description: President Donald Trump said he has identified a buyer for the US operations of TikTok, the social media app owned by Chinese company ByteDance Ltd., without naming the winning bidder.
item.dc:creator: Hadriana Lowenkron, Maria Paula Mijares Torres

media:content.media:description: The TikTok app page in the Google Play store on a smartphone arranged in the Queens borough of New York, US, on Wednesday, Jan. 15, 2025. The Supreme Court signaled it's likely to uphold a law that would ban the popular TikTok social media platform in the US if it isn't sold by its Chinese parent company by Jan. 19.

item.title: Stephen Miller Directs Trump’s Policies on Immigration, Ivy League
item.description: The Trump White House is moving at a far faster clip in 2025 to remake the federal government and American life, in large part because Stephen Miller has put the agenda on steroids.
item.dc:creator: Nancy Cook

media:content.media:description: Stephen Miller, deputy White House chief of staff for policy and other aides during a cabinet meeting at the White House.

item.title: Tariff Bullying Is Working Too Well in Europe
item.description: A coalition of the willing against US threats is struggling to take form.
item.dc:creator: Lionel Laurent

media:content.media:description: Leaders from European Union countries at a European Council meeting in Brussels on Thursday, June 26, 2025.

item.title: Trump Tax Bill Hits Senate as GOP Torn by Competing Demands
item.description: Senate Majority Leader John Thune is rushing to meet President Donald Trump’s July 4 deadline for pushing through his massive tax and spending bill, but first he has to work through a list of approximately eight Republican senators who have expressed opposition to portions of it.
item.dc:creator: Laura Davison, Erik Wasson

media:content.media:description: Senate Majority Leader John Thune

item.title: Philippines, Lithuania Elevate Defense Ties Amid China Tensions
item.description: The Philippines and Lithuania have agreed to strengthen defense ties, as both nations face maritime security threats.
item.dc:creator: Cliff Harvey Venzon

media:content.media:description: Lithuanian soldiers.

item.title: China’s Communist Party Inches Past 100 Million-Member Milestone
item.description: Membership in China’s ruling Communist Party passed the 100 million mark, but the pace of growth slowed for the third straight year amid Beijing’s long-running push to rein in the party’s expansion.
item.dc:creator: Qianwei Zhang, Jing Li

media:content.media:description: Xi Jinping stressed quality above quantity as a goal for the party’s expansion after he took power in 2012.

item.title: Starmer Works to Quell Labour Mutiny Threatening His Future
item.description: Keir Starmer is working to contain the rebellion in his Labour Party ahead of a vote Tuesday on his flagship welfare policy that’s provoked widespread criticism and called his leadership into doubt.
item.dc:creator: Alex Wickham

media:content.media:description: Protesters demonstrate against cuts to disability benefits, in Westminster, London, in March.

item.title: Canada Drops Digital Tax That Infuriated Trump to Restart Trade Talks
item.description: Canada has withdrawn its digital services tax on technology companies such as Meta Platforms Inc. and Alphabet Inc. in a move to restart trade talks with the US.
item.dc:creator: Melissa Shin, Derek Decloet

media:content.media:description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney and US President Donald Trump. Photographer: Geoff Robins/Getty Images

item.title: Lower UK-US Car Tariffs Take Effect, Without Progress on Steel
item.description: UK car manufacturers can export to the US under a 10% tariff starting Monday, a reduction from the 25% rate imposed by Donald Trump on other countries, as the first elements of an economic agreement between the US president and Prime Minister Keir Starmer come into effect.
item.dc:creator: Alex Wickham

item.title: Hong Kong’s Last Active Pro-Democracy Group Folds After 19 Years
item.description: One of Hong Kong’s last remaining pro-democracy parties has shut down, marking another blow to a decades-long movement for greater freedoms that has largely collapsed under Beijing’s crackdown on dissent.
item.dc:creator: Alan Wong

media:content.media:description: Chan Po-ying, center, chairperson of the League of Social Democrats, following a news conference with party members on June 29. Photographer: Anadolu/Anadolu Agency

item.title: This Isn’t the Iranian Regime Change You’re Looking For
item.description: Tehran will have to adapt, just not necessarily with another revolution.
item.dc:creator: Marc Champion

media:content.media:description: The Islamic Republic will not change its spots.

item.title: Trump Deals Poised to Fall Short of Sweeping Trade Reforms
item.description: With just 10 days to go until President Donald Trump’s country-specific tariffs are set to resume, the White House appears poised to fall short of the sweeping global trade reforms it promised to achieve during the three months they were on hold.
item.dc:creator: Catherine Lucey, Jenny Leonard

media:content.media:description: Scott Bessent, US treasury secretary, center, following trade talks at Lancaster House in London, UK, on June 9.

item.title: Taiwan Says It Made Constructive Progress in US Trade Talks
item.description: Taiwan said it’s made “constructive progress” in a second round of trade talks with the US, which are aimed at avoiding tariffs imposed by President Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: John Liu

item.title: Iran Says 71 Dead in Israeli Strike on Tehran Prison
item.description: An Israeli strike this month on Tehran’s Evin prison killed 71 people, Iran’s judiciary said, in one of the deadliest single Israeli attacks on Iranian soil.
item.dc:creator: Arsalan Shahla

media:content.media:description: In this picture obtained from the Iranian judiciary's news agency Mizan Online on June 25, 2025, debris are scattered inside the Evin prison complex in Tehran that was hit days ago by an Israeli strike. The Israeli defence minister announced strikes on the prison and other domestic security agencies in Tehran on June 23. (Photo by Mostafa Roudaki / mizanonline / AFP) (Photo by MOSTAFA ROUDAKI/mizanonline/AFP via Getty Images)

item.title: Key Senators Strike Deal To Pause State AI Laws For Five Years
item.description: The Senate is poised to approve a controversial provision preventing some US states from regulating artificial intelligence, marking a victory for the tech companies, venture capital firms and startups that backed it.
item.dc:creator: Oma Seddiq, Emily Birnbaum

item.title: Chilean Communist Jeannette Jara Scores Blowout Win in Presidential Primary
item.description: Chile communist Jeannette Jara won the primary vote among left-wing presidential candidates after mounting a last-minute surge, trouncing other contenders including a moderate politician who was the early favorite.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Malinowski, Valentina Fuentes

media:content.media:description: Jeannette Jara on June 29.

item.title: China’s Envoy Urges Australia to Resist US Pressure on Military Spending
item.description: China’s envoy to Canberra urged Australia not to be “incited” by NATO’s support for US demands to sharply raise defense spending and instead cooperate with Beijing to resolve regional disputes.
item.dc:creator: Michael Heath

media:content.media:description: Xiao Qian Photographer: Dasril Roszandi/NurPhoto/Getty Images

item.title: Tax Bill Would Add $3.3 Trillion to US Deficits, CBO Says
item.description: The Senate version of President Donald Trump’s tax and spending measure would add nearly $3.3 trillion to US deficits over a decade, according to a new estimate from the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office.
item.dc:creator: Jarrell Dillard

media:content.media:description: The rotunda of the US Capitol in Washington, DC, US, on Thursday, June 5, 2025. US House Speaker Mike Johnson said he is fighting to maintain the new $40,000 cap on state and local deductions in the draft tax bill now before the Senate, where Republicans are seeking to enact a less generous break.

item.title: Senate GOP Restores Medicaid Cuts to Trump Tax Package
item.description: Senate Republicans restored major Medicaid cuts to Donald Trump’s signature economic legislation, re-fashioning a key provision to overcome a procedural obstacle.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Cohrs Zhang, Erin Durkin

media:content.media:description: Senate Majority Leader John Thune

item.title: Tillis Won’t Seek Reelection After Trump Primary Threat
item.description: North Carolina Senator Thom Tillis said he won’t seek reelection following a primary threat from President Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: Laura Davison, Erik Wasson

media:content.media:description: Senator Thom Tillis Photographer: Tierney L. Cross/Bloomberg

item.title: Indian Official Says Political ‘Constraints’ Led to Jet Losses
item.description: India’s political leadership didn’t permit strikes on Pakistani military bases at the start of hostilities between the two countries in May, allowing Islamabad to shoot down its fighter jets, according to a military official.
item.dc:creator: Sudhi Ranjan Sen

media:content.media:description: Residents look at a wreckage of an unknown aircraft in Wuyan area of Pampore, near Srinagar, Kashmir on May 7, 2025.

item.title: Mamdani Says He’d Rather Have a World Without Billionaires
item.description: Democratic mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani said Sunday that billionaires shouldn’t exist, stepping up his rhetoric in a network television interview against the wealthiest and most powerful New Yorkers.
item.dc:creator: Ian Fisher

media:content.media:description: Zohran Mamdani, New York City mayoral candidate, during a campaign event at the NAN House of Justice in the Harlem neighborhood of New York, US, on Saturday, June 28, 2025. The 33-year-old Queens assemblyman is seeking to consolidate support ahead of the November election, where he'll face off against incumbent Mayor Eric Adams and potentially his chief rival in the primary, Andrew Cuomo, both of whom would run on independent tickets.

item.title: US Envoy Sees F-35 Issue With Turkey Resolved Soon, Anadolu Says
item.description: The US ambassador to Turkey said a resolution to a long-running F-35 dispute between the NATO allies is possible by the end of the year, signaling a potential breakthrough in a yearslong standoff that has strained defense ties.
item.dc:creator: Ugur Yilmaz

media:content.media:description: Tom Barrack

item.title: Trump Tax Bill Advances in Senate as GOP Scrounges for Votes
item.description: President Donald Trump’s $4.5 trillion tax cut bill prevailed in a crucial Senate test vote after hours of negotiations, setting up a fresh round of deal-making as Republicans seek to convince holdouts to support the bill for final passage.
item.dc:creator: Erik Wasson, Steven T. Dennis

media:content.media:description: US Vice President JD Vance at the US Capitol in Washington, DC, US, on Saturday, June 28, 2025. President Donald Trump’s $4.5 trillion tax cut bill prevailed in a crucial Senate test vote, a sign that Republican leaders are resolving the infighting over portions of the legislation and moving toward meeting a July 4 deadline the president has set for passage.

item.title: Trump Says Iran Might Get Sanctions Relief If It Can Be Peaceful
item.description: President Donald Trump suggested he might back eventual sanctions relief for Iran “if they can be peaceful,” combining threats and the prospect of diplomacy after US strikes aimed at destroying Iranian nuclear sites.
item.dc:creator: Hadriana Lowenkron, Maria Paula Mijares Torres

media:content.media:description: A national flag of Islamic Republic of Iran on the wall of the Glass Building that came under Israeli missile attack in Tehran, Iran on June 25, 2025.

item.title: Trump Says He Doesn’t Expect to Extend July 9 Tariff Deadline
item.description: President Donald Trump said he doesn’t think he’ll need to extend the July 9 trade deadline he has imposed on countries to secure deals with the US to avoid higher tariffs.
item.dc:creator: Hadriana Lowenkron, Maria Paula Mijares Torres

media:content.media:description: US President Donald Trump
